object.course_desc: Introduction to the study of film that emphasizes problems and methods of film analysis through the study of various types of films. Topics relating to the filmmaker, film genre, and film history are covered through a focus on questions of style and technique.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for FILM1120, FILM 1000 (no longer offered), and FYSM1510.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, discussion one hour a week.

object.course_desc: A seminar in the study of film that emphasizes problems and methods of film analysis through the study of a variety of types of films.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for FILM1101, FILM 1000 (no longer offered) and FYSM1510.
Prerequisite(s): enrolment in a Film Studies major.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, discussion one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: enrolment in a Film Studies major.

object.course_desc: Introduction to major film theories and analytical practices. The objective of this course is to familiarize students with the main theories and methods of analysis that have been developed for the study of film.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for FILM 2000 (no longer offered).
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120 and second-year standing; or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, seminar one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120 and second-year standing; or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Building on the skills acquired in FILM 2001, this course considers specific debates in film theory, and provides students with advanced methods for film analysis.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for FILM 2000 (no longer offered).
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, and FILM2001, and second-year standing; or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, seminar one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, and FILM2001, and second-year standing; or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: The organization of the production, distribution and exhibition practices of various film industries. May include an examination of the relationship between a national film industry and its television industry.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: An examination of the work of individual filmmakers, of documentary styles and of organizations and institutions in the context of the history of documentary film making, including documentaries made for television. Non-fiction films other than documentaries may be considered.
object.course_extra_details:
Also listed as JOUR2106.
Precludes additional credit for FILM 2105 (no longer offered), JOUR 2105 (no longer offered).
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: This course examines the film production of specific countries in order to determine the themes, the styles, and the character of a national cinema.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Various practices and movements in the history of Japanese cinema, ranging from the silent era to the current digital age.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: The development of cinema culture and film production in the Scandinavian countries, from the golden age of Scandinavian silent cinema to contemporary Nordic noir.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: A critical examination of films and other audiovisual media created by Indigenous artists, such as independent films, genre films, documentaries, web series, installations, and video games.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Department.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Department.

object.course_desc: A critical examination of Canadian cinema and media and how it relates to other aspects of Canadian culture.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for FILM 2207 (no longer offered), FILM 2208 (no longer offered), FILM 2209 (no longer offered).
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120 or second-year standing; or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, seminar one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120 or second-year standing; or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: A detailed study of the themes, the characteristic style, development and influence of one or more directors.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: This course examines questions of generic form, drawing examples from world cinema.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Historical survey of world cinema primarily from 1895 to 1945, examining the forms, structures and stylistic conventions of various periods and nations.
object.course_extra_details:
Also listed as ENGL2600.
Precludes additional credit for FILM 2608 and ENGL 2608 (no longer offered).
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, and second-year standing, or permission of the discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, and second-year standing, or permission of the discipline.

object.course_desc: Historical survey of world cinema primarily since 1945, examining the forms, structures and stylistic conventions of various periods and nations.
object.course_extra_details:
Also listed as ENGL2601.
Precludes additional credit for FILM 2608 and ENGL 2608 (no longer offered).
Prerequisite(s): FILM2606 or ENGL2600 or permission of the discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM2606 or ENGL2600 or permission of the discipline.

object.course_desc: Introduction to the basic principles of film and media practice. Emphasis may change from year to year, focusing alternately on narrative, experimental, animation or documentary techniques. This course is intended for Film Studies majors only.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120.
Lecture/workshops four hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120.

object.course_desc: Introduction to the video game as a popular media form, an emerging aesthetic, and a social and cultural practice. Topics include: history of video games; game form; game industry; narrative; art and design; interactivity; theories of play.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, or second-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Theoretical implications of documentary film and documentary television practice.
object.course_extra_details:
Also listed as JOUR3105.
Prerequisite(s): 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000-level and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000-level and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Studies in various aspects of American cinema with emphasis on historical and critical issues.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Studies in various aspects of Canadian cinema. Topics may vary from year to year.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: A study of selected topics in gender and cinema with emphasis on critical and historical questions.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000-level and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000-level and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: The use of music in film, from the silent era to the present day. Techniques, styles and theory of film music through the examination of selected scenes.
object.course_extra_details:
Also listed as MUSI3402.
Lectures three hours a week, screening two hours a week.

object.course_desc: Building on the skills acquired in FILM 2000, this course provides a critical study of advanced film theories. Topics may include aesthetics, ideological criticism, film and philosophy, and theories of technology and historiography.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for FILM 3505 (no longer offered).
Prerequisite(s): FILM2001 and FILM2002 and third-year standing; or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM2001 and FILM2002 and third-year standing; or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Critical reflection on notable filmmakers, formal and thematic trends, dominant social and political issues, and diverse cultural perspectives in Québec cinema during the 21stcentury, including the film movement known as the Québec New Wave (Renouveau du cinéma québécois). French language ability not required.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): 1.0 credit in FILM and third-year standing or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: 1.0 credit in FILM and third-year standing or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Studies of aspects of the history of world cinema.  Topics will vary from year to year and may include the examination of film movements, styles and genres, and/or comparative study of national, regional and/or world-wide trends.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Major figures and movements in African cinema around such categories as the colonial, the anti-colonial, the postcolonial, the diasporic, the continental, race, Afro-futurism, and world cinema, interrogating in the process the very category of “African cinema”.
object.course_extra_details:
Also listed as AFRI3609.
Prerequisite(s): 1.0 credit in FILM and third year standing or permission of instructor.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: 1.0 credit in FILM and third year standing or permission of instructor.

object.course_desc: A study of selected topics in animation, video or experimental film.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Consideration of topics in film/video archival or curatorial practice, including questions related to cultural policy, exhibition, conservation, and interrelationship of media. Students are expected to bear all travel and other costs arising from required visits to local facilities.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Precludes additional credit for FILM 4800 (no longer offered).
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Practical and conceptual approaches to film studies from the point of view of film and media practice.  Emphasis may change from year to year, focusing alternately on narrative, experimental, animation or documentary techniques.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Prerequisite(s): FILM2001 and FILM2801.
Lecture/workshops four hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM2001 and FILM2801.

object.course_desc: The technological development of cinema. Topics may include advances in sound and colour processes, digital effects, exhibition technologies and new media.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: History, aesthetics, and theories of digital media and culture. Key concepts in digital media studies, including: digital cinema, interactive documentaries, viral videos, web series, emerging immersive platforms.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Questions related to sound in film and media such as: how is sound used to create narratives and emotions? How does sound affect our experience of actual and fictional worlds?.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Selected topics and issues not ordinarily treated in the third-year course program.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture one hour a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 2000 level, and third-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: An intermediate workshop involving regular assignments in writing for film.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Also listed as ENGL3902.
Prerequisite(s): a grade of B+ or higher in one of: ENGL2901, ENGL2903, ENGL2915; or departmental permission.
Workshop three hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: a grade of B+ or higher in one of: ENGL2901, ENGL2903, ENGL2915; or departmental permission.

object.course_desc: Study of various methodologies for critical, theoretical and historical research in film studies.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for FILM 4000 (no longer offered).
Prerequisite(s): FILM2002, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000-level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, lecture two hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM2002, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000-level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Selected aspects of the audio-visual cultures of the late nineteenth and twentieth centuries.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Seminar three hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: A study of a selected topic in national cinema.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, seminar two hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Theoretical and critical study of the film festival as a phenomenon shaping our understanding of film culture, institutions, history and forms. Issues examined may include festivals as sites of cultural legitimation; as spectacle; their political economy; curation/programming; case studies of film festivals around the world.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, seminar two hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Selected topics in philosophical approaches to the study of film, and an examination of the relations between film theory and philosophical aesthetics.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Also offered at the graduate level, with different requirements, as FILM5109, for which additional credit is precluded.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, seminar two hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: A study of questions of authorship in the cinema, concentrating on one or more filmmakers.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, seminar two hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: A study of a selected topic in film theory.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Lecture and screening three hours a week, seminar two hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Practical experience through working on specific projects under the supervision of staff at a museum, gallery, archive, or production company in the Ottawa area. A maximum of 0.5 credit Film Studies practica courses may be offered in fulfilment of Film Studies requirements. Graded SAT/UNS.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Prerequisite(s): fourth-year Honours standing in Film Studies, a CGPA of 9.00 or higher in Film Studies, and permission of the Discipline.
object.course_prerequisites: fourth-year Honours standing in Film Studies, a CGPA of 9.00 or higher in Film Studies, and permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: Selected topics in film studies not ordinarily available in the regular course program. The choice of topic or topics will vary at least every two years and will be announced well in advance of the registration period.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.
Screening three hours a week, seminar two hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: FILM1101 or FILM1120, 1.0 credit in FILM at the 3000 level, and fourth-year standing, or permission of the Discipline.

object.course_desc: For students who wish to study a specific topic. Proposed projects must be approved by the Program Committee. Written request outlining the project must be submitted by the first day of the term. An essay is the usual assignment.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Prerequisite(s): fourth-year Honours standing in Film Studies and a CGPA of 10.00 or higher in Film Studies.
Unscheduled.
object.course_prerequisites: fourth-year Honours standing in Film Studies and a CGPA of 10.00 or higher in Film Studies.
